comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Family of Japan's Foreign Minister Baron Ishii?

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Quite likely yes, another photograph in the New-York tribune., August 17, 1919, Page 5 (unfortunately not in very good quality) shows the children of Viscount Ishii Kikujirō, at that time ambassador to the United States, receiving a letter from their daddy.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Another Bain photo in the LOC collection, Ishii with wife and daughter: www.loc.gov/pictures/item/ggb2006000569/ However, the wife and daughter in this undated image is part of an apparent composite photo, credited to Underwood and Underwood, which ran in the February 19, 1918 Rochester Democrat Chronicle. That means the girl in the photo above is either a different Ishii daughter or the photo is much earlier than 1918. fultonhistory.com/Process%20Small/Newspapers/Rochester%20... And here is a photo which was published about the same time, showing the Ishiis with a small daughter: fultonhistory.com/Newspaper%209/New%20York%20NY%20Sun/New...

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: This fits, the wife (at right in the Bain photo) and the small daughter are obviously the same as in the photo depicted in the Sun, April 21, 1918. The other woman in the Bain photo is the older daughter IMO.

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: B-59 and artolog: Thanks for the additional research on this photo, which will let us better identify the family depicted.
